Original idea was to loop through receipts_for(current_user) and try to find one where the message recipient or sender is the current target recipient and reply to that one? Is there a better way to do this?

Original idea was to loop through receipts_for(current_user) and try to find one where the message recipient or sender is the current target recipient and reply to that one? Is there a better way to do this?

html:
I don’t believe there is a way to attach an object to a message. Not formally that is. However, the send_message method on the Messageable object returns the receipt for the sender’s message. So you could do something like:

something = SomeObject.new
receipt = user.send_message(put, params, here)
receipt.message.notified_object = something
receipt.save!

I haven’t tested this, but I believe it will work for ya.
text:
I don’t believe there is a way to attach an object to a message.  Not formally that is.  However, the `send_message` method on the `Messageable` object returns the receipt for the sender’s message.  So you could do something like:

```ruby
something = SomeObject.new
receipt = user.send_message(put, params, here)
receipt.message.notified_object = something
receipt.save!
```

I haven’t tested this, but I believe it will work for ya.

html: Does anyone know of a reason why Mailboxer::Notification.id and Mailboxer::Receipt.id would go out of sync? I know they're not foreign keys, but they have been in sync up until recently. And then lots of things broke because we were finding notifications by receipt id! (notification = Mailboxer::Notification.find_by(id: receipt.id)
text: Does anyone know of a reason why Mailboxer::Notification.id and Mailboxer::Receipt.id would go out of sync? I know they're not foreign keys, but they have been in sync up until recently. And then lots of things broke because we were finding notifications by receipt id! (notification = Mailboxer::Notification.find_by(id: receipt.id)

html: we pass the notification data on to GCM for push notifications and the result is that everyone gets notified about the previous notification event (which usually has nothing to do with them...). Horrible to get to the bottom of. I see now we shouldn't find notifications by Mailboxer::Notification.find_by(id: receipt.id), but I am concerned that there are differences between the total numbers of receipts and notifications
text: we pass the notification data on to GCM for push notifications and the result is that everyone gets notified about the previous notification event (which usually has nothing to do with them...). Horrible to get to the bottom of. I see now we shouldn't find notifications by Mailboxer::Notification.find_by(id: receipt.id), but I am concerned that there are differences between the total numbers of receipts and notifications

html:
Hi guys, I'm wondering how I can preview Mailboxer emails using Rails' email preview functionality? I'm not too sure on how to handle this. :)

# spec/mailers/previews/devise/mailer_preview.rb
class Devise::MailerPreview < ActionMailer::Preview

  def confirmation_instructions
    Devise::Mailer.confirmation_instructions(User.first, "faketoken")
  end

  def reset_password_instructions
    Devise::Mailer.reset_password_instructions(User.first, "faketoken")
  end
end

^ this would be how I would do it with Devise
text:
Hi guys, I'm wondering how I can preview Mailboxer emails using Rails' email preview functionality? I'm not too sure on how to handle this. :)

```ruby
# spec/mailers/previews/devise/mailer_preview.rb
class Devise::MailerPreview < ActionMailer::Preview

  def confirmation_instructions
    Devise::Mailer.confirmation_instructions(User.first, "faketoken")
  end

  def reset_password_instructions
    Devise::Mailer.reset_password_instructions(User.first, "faketoken")
  end
end
```

^ this would be how I would do it with Devise

Hey mailboxers! im setting things up but running into a snag...

I am getting:
Invalid single-table inheritance type: Mailboxer::Message is not a subclass of Mailboxer::Message

when ever i call:
receipts or conversations

see that the type of the message is being set to Mailboxer::Message automagically...what am I missing?
